thread.title: Minor league baseball: Rutherford’s Bobby Jones to manage Sussex - Baseball
thread.title_full: Minor league baseball: Rutherford’s Bobby Jones to manage Sussex - Baseball - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: Minor league baseball: Rutherford’s Bobby Jones to manage Sussex - Baseball
text:
Former Mets pitcher Bobby Jones of Rutherford is the new manager of the Sussex Miners, the Can-Am League team announced Wednesday.
Jones, 43, who was a three-sport athlete at Rutherford High School, pitched six seasons in the major leagues. The left-hander was a member of the 2000 National League champion Mets and 2004 World Champion Boston Red Sox.
In 2014, he served as pitching coach for the Rockland Boulders as they won the Can-Am League title.
Milwaukee selected Jones in the 44th round of the 1991 amateur draft, and after five seasons in the minors, he made his major-league debut in 1997 for Colorado against the Mets at Shea Stadium. 
The Miners’ new manager pitched for the Rockies from 1997-99, Mets in 2000 and 2002, San Diego Padres in 2002 and Red Sox in 2004.
Jones is one of five Rutherford products to pitch in the major leagues.
